Shortcuts

CBD.lib.std module¶

This file contains the standard library for CBD building blocks.

class CBD.lib.std.ConstantBlock(block_name, value=0.0)[source]¶

Bases: CBD.Core.BaseBlock

The constant block will always output its constant value

getValue()[source]¶

Get the current value.

setValue(value)[source]¶

Change the constant value.

compute(curIteration)[source]¶

Computes this block’s operation, based on its inputs and store it as an output signal.

Parameters:curIteration (int) – The iteration at which we must compute this value.

Bases: CBD.Core.BaseBlock

The adderblock will add all the inputs.

  • numberOfInputs (int) – The amount of input ports to set.

class CBD.lib.std.ClampBlock(block_name, min=-1, max=1, use_const=True)[source]¶

Bases: CBD.Core.BaseBlock

The clamp block will clamp the input between min and max.

Parameters:
  • block_name (str) – The name of the block.
  • min (numeric) – The minimal value.
  • max (numeric) – The maximal value.
  • use_const (bool) – When True, the min and max values will be used. Otherwise, the minimal and maximal values are expected as inputs 2 and 3, respectively.
compute(curIteration)[source]¶

Computes this block’s operation, based on its inputs and store it as an output signal.

Parameters:curIteration (int) – The iteration at which we must compute this value.
class CBD.lib.std.GenericBlock(block_name, block_operator=None)[source]¶

Bases: CBD.Core.BaseBlock

The generic block will evaluate the operator on the input operator is the name (a string) of a Python function from the math library which will be called when the block is evaluated by default, initialized to None

getBlockOperator()[source]¶

Gets the block operator.

Parameters:curIteration (int) – The iteration at which we must compute this value.
class CBD.lib.std.MultiplexerBlock(block_name)[source]¶

Bases: CBD.Core.BaseBlock

The multiplexer block will output the signal from IN1 if select == 0; otherwise the signal from IN2 is outputted.

class CBD.lib.std.SplitBlock(block_name, numberOfOutputs=2)[source]¶

Bases: CBD.Core.BaseBlock

The split block will split a signal over multiple paths. While this block can generally be omitted, it may still be used for clarity and clean-ness of the resulting models.

Parameters:
  • block_name (str) – The name of the block.
  • numberOfOutputs (int) – The amount of paths to split into.
compute(curIteration)[source]¶

Computes this block’s operation, based on its inputs and store it as an output signal.

Parameters:curIteration (int) – The iteration at which we must compute this value.
getNumberOfOutputs()[source]¶

Gets the total number of output ports.

class CBD.lib.std.AddOneBlock(block_name)[source]¶

Bases: CBD.Core.CBD

Block adds a one to the input (used a lot for mux)

class CBD.lib.std.DerivatorBlock(block_name)[source]¶

Bases: CBD.Core.CBD

The derivator block is a CBD that calculates the derivative.

class CBD.lib.std.IntegratorBlock(block_name)[source]¶

Bases: CBD.Core.CBD

The integrator block is a CBD that calculates the integration. The block is implemented according to the backwards Euler rule.

class CBD.lib.std.Clock(block_name, start_time=0.0)[source]¶

Bases: CBD.Core.CBD

System clock. Must be present in a simulation model.

Parameters:
  • block_name (str) – The name of the block.
  • start_time (float) – Time at which the simulation starts. Defaults to 0.
Input Ports:
  • h: The delta in-between timesteps. For fixed-rate simulations, this must be linked up to a constant value (e.g. a ConstantBlock).
Output Ports:
  • time: The current simulation time.
  • rel_time: The relative simulation time, ignoring the start time.
getTime(curIt)[source]¶

Gets the current time of the clock.

getRelativeTime(curIt)[source]¶

Gets the relative simulation time (ignoring the start time).

setStartTime(start_time=0.0)[source]¶
class CBD.lib.std.TimeBlock(block_name)[source]¶

Bases: CBD.Core.BaseBlock

Obtains the current time of the simulation.

Parameters:block_name (str) – The name of the block.

Note

When manipulating and reading time values, it may be better to use the Clock instead.

compute(curIteration)[source]¶

Computes this block’s operation, based on its inputs and store it as an output signal.

Parameters:curIteration (int) – The iteration at which we must compute this value.
